description: US President-elect Donald Trump has invited Chinese President Xi Jinping to attend his inauguration next month, CBS reported, citing multiple sources.
title: Trump Invites China’s Xi Jinping to Inauguration, CBS Says

description: Israel carried out more military operations in Syria on Wednesday while facing intensifying criticism from governments in the region.
title: Israel Continues Military Operations in Syria Despite Backlash

description: Government ministers are planning to slash more than 10,000 jobs in the UK’s civil service, amid a cost-cutting drive aimed at freeing up cash for essential spending.
title: UK Under Pressure to Slash More Than 10,000 Civil Service Jobs

description: US agencies that produce vital economic data are struggling in the face of shrinking budgets.
title: Market-Moving Data Under Threat as Trump Returns to Washington

description: Lebanese troops are deploying in the town of Khiam as part of a US-brokered ceasefire with Israel designed to secure the former fiefdom of Iranian-backed Hezbollah fighters in southern Lebanon, the Israeli army said.
title: Israel Ceding First Southern Lebanon Town to Beirut’s Army Under Truce

description: Donald Trump’s pick for national security adviser vowed a return to the maximum pressure campaign that defined Iran policy in the president-elect’s first term, even as leaders in Tehran signal they want to reduce tension.
title: Trump’s National Security Pick Vows Return to Maximum Pressure on Iran

description: Luigi Mangione, the man arrested in the fatal Dec. 4 shooting of Brian Thompson, chief executive officer of UnitedHealth Group Inc., was carrying a gun and silencer that police said appeared to have been assembled from parts created mostly with a 3D printer. The discovery renewed scrutiny of so-called ghost guns. US authorities have charted a dramatic rise over the last decade in the criminal use of this class of weapon, which is the subject of a case before the Supreme Court.
title: What Are Ghost Guns Like the One Found on CEO Shooting Suspect?

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Skylar Woodhouse looks at how Donald Trump has cast his administration. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Reaches for Stars to Fill His Television Cabinet

description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will go through another medical procedure on Thursday following brain surgery earlier this week, Hospital Sirio-Libanes said in a statement as doubts swirl about his health.
title: Lula to Have New Medical Procedure Following Brain Surgery

description: FBI Director Christopher Wray announced he will resign before President-elect Donald Trump takes office, prematurely ending his historic and tumultuous tenure as head of the nation’s top investigative law enforcement agency.
title: FBI Director Christopher Wray to Resign at End of Biden’s Term

description: French President Emmanuel Macron and Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk are set to discuss the possibility of sending European troops for a peacekeeping mission to Ukraine once a ceasefire is reached, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Macron, Tusk to Discuss Sending Troops to Ukraine After Ceasefire

description: Republican House members lambasted Secretary of State Antony Blinken over the chaotic US withdrawal from Afghanistan as the top US diplomat testified Wednesday in a long-delayed appearance before the House Foreign Affairs Committee.
title: House Republicans, Blinken Clash in Showdown Over Afghanistan Outcome

description: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said that a softer global oil market might create an opportunity for further action against Russia’s energy sector, as the US continues its efforts to impair Moscow’s ability wage war against Ukraine.
title: Yellen Sees ‘Opportunity’ for Action Against Russia in Softer Oil Market

description: The British monarchy took a hit this week as Jamaica introduced a bill that would ditch King Charles III as its symbolic head of state and turn the Caribbean nation into a full-fledged republic.
title: Jamaica Renews Push to Abandon British Monarchy, Become Republic

description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen urged the next US administration to maintain the dialogue channels that she re-established with China, speaking on the eve of what’s likely to be the last round of economic and financial talks between senior officials from the two nations.
title: US-China Economy Talks Resume as Yellen Urges Maintaining Links

description: Premiums for gold and silver futures in New York swelled as traders weighed the possibility of precious metals being included in sweeping tariff measures proposed by US President-elect Donald Trump.
title: Trump Tariff Risk Roils Gold and Silver as New York Prices Jump

description: Donald Trump is slated to ring the New York Stock Exchange’s opening bell on Thursday, presenting a president-elect who has vowed to rejuvenate the US economy a celebratory photo opportunity at an iconic symbol of American capitalism.
title: Trump Scheduled to Ring NYSE’s Opening Bell on Thursday

description: The European Union gave preliminary backing to a 15th package of sanctions against Russia that includes an extension of an exemption for Slovakia to trade petroleum products derived from Russian oil through early June.
title: EU Backs Russian Sanctions Package With Concession to Slovakia

description: Khalil Ur-Rahman Haqqani, the Taliban’s minister for refugees and repatriation, was killed Wednesday in a suicide bombing at his office in Kabul, marking the highest-profile casualty since the group retook power three years ago.
title: Suicide Blast in Kabul Kills Highest-Profile Taliban Target Yet

description: Mirella Abou Shanab, a Damascus-based TV presenter and producer, went into a pastry shop in the Syrian capital and saw armed Islamist fighters eating ice cream and cake. One of them turned to her and asked if she was Christian, Druze or Shiite and whether that’s why she wasn’t wearing a veil.
title: Militant Leader End Game Is Big Unknown in Post-Assad Syria

description: Democratic Republic of Congo’s President Felix Tshisekedi defended an initiative to amend the constitution, a move opposition leaders have warned he could use to extend his term in office.
title: Congo Leader Tshisekedi Defends Plan to Change Constitution

description: The UK government will indefinitely ban prescriptions of puberty blockers for children in cases of gender dysphoria, the condition characterized by distress over the incongruence between one’s gender identity and birth-assigned sex.
title: UK Bans Puberty Blockers for Under-18s With Gender Dysphoria

description: Russia may fire another intermediate-range ballistic missile at Ukraine in the coming days, according to a US official.
title: US Says Russia May Fire Oreshnik at Ukraine in Days

description: Local branches of the Conservative Party and Reform UK have held talks about unofficial pacts ahead of local council elections next year, a bid to unite right-wing voters against Keir Starmer’s governing Labour Party.
title: Tories, Reform UK Discuss Election Pacts as Musk Boosts Farage

description: A bipartisan coalition of US lawmakers have drafted legislation that would force prescription drug middlemen to divest pharmacies they own, according to materials reviewed by Bloomberg News.
title: Lawmakers Plan Bill Forcing Drug Middlemen to Sell Pharmacies

description: First reality-show star-turned-president pulls from ranks of entertainment, media as he prepares to retake power
title: MTV, Fox News Stars Abound as Trump Taps Television for Cabinet

description: President-elect Donald Trump won a court order halting a lawsuit against him by the co-founders of his social media platform so a Delaware judge can weigh whether presidential immunity applies to the case.
title: Trump Wins Delay in Truth Social Deal Suit With Immunity Claims

description: UK prisons will run out of capacity even with the government’s plan to add thousands more places, Justice Secretary Shabana Mahmood said, underscoring the scale of a crisis that has already forced the new Labour administration to release prisoners early to ease overcrowding.
title: Prisons Face Overcrowding Even After Expansion, UK Minister Says

description: The United Nations atomic watchdog said a probe into potential Syrian nuclear-weapons activities was interrupted by the ouster of President Bashar Al-Assad, just as monitors closed in on a breakthrough in the long-running investigation.
title: Syrian Atomic-Weapons Probe Disrupted by Assad Ouster, IAEA Says

description: Argentina’s libertarian president derides universities as bastions of wokeness and elitism. But publicly funded higher education is a point of civic pride.
title: College Graduates Are Turning on Milei After Helping Him Win Power

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Humbled Iran Weighs Next Steps After Assad Exit

description: France’s caretaker administration will present an emergency finance bill to parliament on Wednesday to avoid a shutdown after the country’s government and its 2025 budget bill fell in a no-confidence vote last week.
title: France Presents Emergency Legislation to Avoid Shutdown

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban called Russian President Vladimir Putin on Wednesday, extending his latest flurry of diplomatic activities after a meeting with US President-elect Donald Trump earlier in the week.
title: Orban Calls Russia’s Putin on Ukraine After Trump Meeting

description: Scott Bessent, President-elect Donald Trump’s pick to serve as Treasury secretary, is planning to meet with several Republican senators on Wednesday as he continues to build support for his nomination.
title: Bessent to Meet Senators as He Preps for Treasury Secretary Vote

description: Early in his term as Brazil’s central bank chief, Roberto Campos Neto racked up awards as he tamed a post-pandemic inflation spike and then started an easing cycle well before advanced economies, all while spearheading the creation of a cutting-edge payment system.
title: Brazil’s Acclaimed Central Bank Chief Roberto Campos Neto Gets Reality Check as Term Ends

description: With Syrian opposition forces advancing rapidly toward the capital, Damascus, President Bashar al-Assad’s fate lay in Russia’s hands as his army melted away.
title: Russia Pushed Assad to Flee Syria After Concluding He’d Lost War

description: Bank of Japan officials see little cost to waiting before raising interest rates while still being open to a hike next week depending on data and market developments, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: BOJ Is Said to See Little Cost to Waiting for Next Rate Hike

description: Thailand unveiled a fresh set of debt-relief measures to cover millions of retail borrowers and small businesses struggling to repay loans, the latest bid by authorities to tackle the highest level of household debt in Southeast Asia.
title: Thailand Unveils Debt-Relief Measures to Cover $26 Billion Loans

description: NATO plans to assign new concrete targets for how many more tanks, planes and other weapon systems member countries need to produce, which may require raising the alliance’s defense spending goal to as much as 3% of gross domestic product, according to officials familiar with the matter.
title: NATO Weighs New Weapons, Equipment Targets for Member Countries

description: Poland’s Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski said lower interest rates would be supportive for investments, adding that there are communication problems with the central bank.
title: Polish Finance Chief Says Lower Rates Would Help Economy

description: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte on Wednesday said she’s preparing her defense against the impeachment complaints filed against her, as she expressed doubts over getting enough support among legislators to fight it.
title: Philippines VP Duterte Preparing Defense Against Impeachment Bid

description: The United Arab Emirates finalized an economic agreement with the Eurasian Economic Union aimed at increasing non-oil bilateral trade through the reduction of tariffs and elimination of trade barriers.
title: UAE Finalizes Pact to Boost Trade With Nations Including Russia

description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz is due to file a petition with Germany’s lower house of parliament on Wednesday formally requesting a Dec. 16 confidence vote that will trigger a snap election in late February.
title: Scholz to Request Confidence Vote Triggering February Election

description: North Korea blasted South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s attempt to impose martial law last week, in its first comments on the political drama unfolding in its neighbor.
title: North Korea Slams Yoon ‘Dictatorship’ in First Comment on Crisis

description: China has condemned sanctions by Canada on eight Chinese officials for alleged human rights violations, opening a fresh fissure in already strained bilateral ties.
title: China Vows Response to Canada Sanctions for Alleged Rights Abuse

description: China said it will impose visa restrictions on some US officials for their alleged meddling in Hong Kong’s affairs, in a tit-for-tat move that highlights rising geopolitical tensions over the Asian finance center before Donald Trump takes office.
title: China to Restrict Visas to US Officials for Threatening HK Curbs

description: The Islamic Republic's ‘Axis of Resistance’ is broken and the regime is rattled as Donald Trump prepares to return to the White House.
title: Assad’s Fall Jolts Iran’s Increasingly Vulnerable Leadership

description: The World Bank expects Myanmar’s economy to contract in the current fiscal year, as elevated inflation, a slumping currency, and electricity and labor shortages further pressure a war-torn nation.
title: World Bank Sees Myanmar Economy Shrinking as Civil War Rages On

description: Luigi Mangione’s arrest this week over the fatal shooting of UnitedHealth Group executive Brian Thompson has failed to fill in some key details of the shocking killing that has gripped the US.
title: Arrest in Shock CEO Murder Still Leaves Key Questions Unanswered

description: The Philippines’ National Bureau of Investigation will proceed with probing Vice President Sara Duterte’s apparent threat to have President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. assassinated if she’s killed after she failed to appear for questioning for a second time on Wednesday.
title: Philippines Says Probe to Go Ahead as Duterte Skips Questioning

description: The chair of Japan’s metalworkers’ union urged the government to accelerate efforts to raise pay, while expressing concern over premature tightening steps from the central bank.
title: Japan Union Head Calls for Government to Accelerate Wage Efforts

description: The swift collapse of Bashar Al-Assad’s regime in Syria threatens a key Russian airbase in the country that Moscow has depended on to project influence throughout Africa.
title: Russia’s Africa Strategy at Risk After Syria Regime Collapse

description: China got a head start on a looming trade war with the US by showcasing a new range of tools it’s prepared to use if Donald Trump makes good on his threat to punish the world’s second-biggest economy with tariffs.
title: Xi Readies Bargaining Chips for US Trade War After Biden Curbs

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol will fight a possible impeachment rather than step down early, a local media report said, a stance that would likely lengthen the duration of the political chaos sparked by his martial law declaration.
title: South Korea’s President Prefers Impeachment Over Quitting, Report Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump said he would name Ronald Johnson as his ambassador to Mexico, selecting a former appointee to manage one of the most important US relationships through escalating tensions over immigration and trade.
title: Trump Picks Ex-El Salvador Envoy Johnson as Mexico Ambassador

description: The Biden administration is weighing new, harsher sanctions against Russia’s lucrative oil trade, seeking to tighten the squeeze on the Kremlin’s war machine just weeks before Donald Trump returns to the White House.
title: US Mulls New Russia Oil Sanctions to Weaken Putin Ahead of Trump
